See what I mean!
 
nothin but a shit stirrer.
Always comes up with these l=
ittle innuendo's
and accusations. 
 
Your so concerned with file tampering =
check your friends files first,
 
Oh that's right there has never been one =
posted! oops my mistake.
anyway go crawl back to your master and say we are=
 wise to this bullshit already.
 
I just explained why and how I remove tim=
e from my files and I'm not the only
researcher that does that. Matter of f=
act I believe it's common practice. 
 
And even with the segments of noise =
between the words being removed the files
are what they are no words have b=
een altered, and they are posted for all to hear.
More than I can say for s=
ome supposed researchers.
 
don't worry so much about time being removed fr=
om our files try concentrating on people 
hiding in balconies with micropho=
nes.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: babiarz3@ya=
hoo.comDate: Mon, 21 Jan 2008 17:07:05 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Babs has=
 Issues!




Time is absolutely being removed from the audio files. There i=
s somuch more than just listening to the files, you have too look. Youhave =
to train your eyes as well as your ears to make any sort ofjudgment. The se=
cond I load some of these files, before I listen, Isee problems. I know the=
 site isn't set up to really leave comments onfiles with the file but somet=
hing should be included in the name orsomething. Without it, it is not true=
 representation of what the fileis or what has happened between the capture=
 and the post. We listenand think "Wow! Great catch" but we really do not k=
now. Are you starting the scan on your 3 469's at different frequencies?Wha=
t is the ratio being mixed? Is it equal between the three? I believe that M=
ark and Debbie Constantino (sp)of Nevada use wateralmost exclusively for th=
eir recordings. I have found that method tobe difficult in hearing the resu=
lts. Are you feeling that thosecommunications are from spirits or earthboun=
ds and what makes you feelthat way?I've recently started analyzing a 40 min=
 469 session. The results arescary. I'd say at this point, and I'm only 1/2=
 way through, 90% of thecommunication is negative in nature and mentions ma=
ny supposed Demonicnames. The layers of voices are, in many cases, multiple=
. Often, thelistener hears very little of what is actually said. The voices=
 can bemocking or downright crude. I have not yet formed an opinion fully b=
utit would seem to me that these models are easy devices for lower levelent=
ities to figure out how to use. I can not speak of the attitudes orfears of=
 those investigators present although at times, their voicesare a bit shaky=
. Babs--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:=
>> Very good observation Babs. Let me say that you have many friendsand ass=
ociates here just for the simple fact that you have an interestin ITC, are =
a researcher and a complex thinker. I think we have shownin the past that w=
e can have a disagreement and still remain friends.You make a lot of good p=
oints in your post and I would like to knowwho removes time from their reco=
rdings. I have never removed time frommy recordings and see no reason why a=
nyone else would without sayingso in an accompanied post.> > I have limited=
 experience with the 12-469's as a single piece ofequipment. I have arrange=
d mine per Mike's, "Spiricomp" design. I have3, 12-469's feeding a four cha=
nnel mixer, which goes into a laptoprunning DC6 with Soundsoap 2. Mine scan=
 equally spaced on the FM band.I have had pretty good results until recentl=
y.> > At first the messages were pretty clear but I had a feeling I wasgett=
ing a different group than I normally have for the last few years.When I wo=
uld ask about my friends on the other side they would tell methey will look=
 for them. Well about 2 weeks ago the 12-469 arrangementstarted generating =
a lot of interference and feedback. I startedhearing radio static voices as=
 I use to get with shortwave. Not voicefragments but voices made of static =
(metallic and robotic). They werebreaking through the sweeping. I had a fee=
ling someone else was tryingto force their way through. Finally the interfe=
rence got so bad I wasforced to revert back to a simpler method I used befo=
re, which isusing fan noise. One of the first messages to come across was f=
rom afamiliar voice telling me and I quote, "your method sucks". I have not=
used the 12-469's since because of the clear messages I have beengetting us=
ing water and fan noise. That does not mean I have given up> on the 12-469'=
s but I won't use them again until I am persuaded toby my friends on the ot=
herside that they are willing to use and adaptto it. To my knowledge only M=
isty, Laura and myself use water forrecording.> > Regards,> > Frank R.> > -=
---- Original Message ----> From: babiarz3 <babiarz3@...>> To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com> Sent: Monday, January 21, 2008 9:34:01 AM> Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
Babs has Issues!> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > Alright, you all know I'm voc=
al and I haven't made any"friends" here> > but, if we can put that aside fo=
r a moment...> > > > Spirit communication has been my passion since day one=
, a little over> > 6 years ago. I am a believer in the afterlife and a beli=
ever in> > spirits attempting to communicate with us for a variety of reaso=
ns. I> > have spiritual beliefs that I feel strongly about and devote much =
of> > my waking (and sleeping) moments to thoughts about this field.> > How=
ever, I am also a researcher and a skeptic. In order for me to> > allow ide=
as to become part of my reality I must experiment. In order> > for me to be=
lieve something is paranormal I HAVE to rule out all other> > possible caus=
es. That being said, I have some questions. My hope is> > that there are so=
me here willing to enter into discussion with me.> > > > I have a difficult=
 time with many of the files here. Many times, there> > is no question incl=
uded in the file. I can not determine whether or> > not the "reply" is an i=
ntelligent reply. Maybe this has to do with> > allowable file size.> > > > =
Some of the files I have been able to download. (I don't always keep> > my =
email settings on for this group as I get too many - lol) When I> > look at=
 the file I see problems. There will be complete flat line> > silence betwe=
en the words. Many times the "reply" is also at the same> > decibel as the =
question askers voice. Those two things should not> > occur naturally consi=
dering the devices being used. That tells me that> > there is manipulation =
of the files. Now, what is manipulation to me,> > may not be manipulation t=
o others. To me, any altering of the recorded> > file constitutes manipulat=
ion. I do not know if the reply was> > intelligent or manipulated to be int=
elligent. > > > > Some say that they simply remove the "no response" time. =
I've been> > told it can be as much as 18 seconds removed from between word=
s. Now> > we run into the problem of us deciding what word fits in with the=
> > question. What words are being ignored? Did we take nonsense and make> =
> sense? Did we amp every noise/word or only what fit?> > > > I think it's =
great that files are offered for peer review. However, I> > think we have t=
o load them untouched or at the very least, offer> > exactly what was done =
to the entire file. Time elapsed between words,> > what was amped, etc. I'd=
 also love to see some of these sessions video> > taped with the question a=
sker facing the camera and a second hand> > clock visible. Truly, we aren't=
 researching if we don't have some> > protocol in place.> > > > Here is an =
issue I have with the RS Hacks. I have the 469. It takes> > approximately 1=
8 seconds to scan through the AM frequencies. Now, the> > typical person wo=
uld think that we can take that 18 seconds and divide> > it by the number o=
f AM stations to determine how long we are on each> > station before moving=
 on to the next one. In that way we could> > determine what is impossible t=
o be said via a radio fragment. However,> > that's not correct. The scan cy=
cle can vary from one frequency to the> > next and of course the biggest pr=
oblem is that some stations are> > picked up over multiple frequencies; AM =
640 can be heard on 630, 640,> > 650, 660 and maybe even 670. That extends =
the time a great deal. This> > is a difficult problem because it is almost =
impossible for the average> > person to be able to make a determination on =
time this way. > > > > I heard about the following today; An experimenter r=
ecords at the same> > time every day Mon-Fri. We hear about the importance =
of meditating,> > automatic writing, etc at the same time every day but wha=
t we have to> > remember with this, is that now we are in essence tuning in=
to the same> > radio show every day. One of my first experiments with the 4=
69 had me> > hearing this deep male voice over and over again. What was he =
trying> > to tell me, I wondered. Than I realized that he was speaking> > a=
pproximately every 18 seconds; every time the scan hit that station.> > So,=
 if you are removing up to 18 seconds between words, then you are> > really=
 only recording the words from one station. > > > > This post is IN NO WAY =
trying to start anything besides discussion> > about some research problems=
. I know that there are those who are not> > concerned with anything more t=
han the communication itself but I think> > that it is of the utmost import=
ance to attempt to factor in some> > protocol in order for this to be consi=
dered serious research at all. > > > > > > > > > > > > > > > <!--> > #ygrp-=

 <BR>
nothin but a shit stirrer.<BR>
=
Always comes up with these little innuendo's<BR>
and accusations. <BR>=

 <BR>
Your so concerned with file tampering check your friends files =
first,<BR>
 <BR>
Oh that's right there has never been one posted! oops=
 my mistake.<BR>
anyway go crawl back to your master and say we are wise to=
 this bullshit already.<BR>
 <BR>
I just explained why and how I remov=
e time from my files and I'm not the only<BR>
researcher that does that. Ma=
tter of fact I believe it's common practice. <BR>
 <BR>
And even with =
the segments of noise between the words being removed the files<BR>
are wha=
t they are no words have been altered, and they are posted for all to hear.=
<BR>
More than I can say for some supposed researchers.<BR>
 <BR>
don'=
t worry so much about time being removed from our files try concentrating o=
n people <BR>
hiding in balconies with microphones.<BR>

Bruce<BR=

Time is=
 absolutely being removed from the audio files. There is so<BR>much more th=
an just listening to the files, you have too look. You<BR>have to train you=
r eyes as well as your ears to make any sort of<BR>judgment. The second I l=
oad some of these files, before I listen, I<BR>see problems. I know the sit=
e isn't set up to really leave comments on<BR>files with the file but somet=
hing should be included in the name or<BR>something. Without it, it is not =
true representation of what the file<BR>is or what has happened between the=
 capture and the post. We listen<BR>and think "Wow! Great catch" but we rea=
lly do not know. <BR><BR>Are you starting the scan on your 3 469's at diffe=
rent frequencies?<BR>What is the ratio being mixed? Is it equal between the=
 three? <BR><BR>I believe that Mark and Debbie Constantino (sp)of Nevada us=
e water<BR>almost exclusively for their recordings. I have found that metho=
d to<BR>be difficult in hearing the results. Are you feeling that those<BR>=
communications are from spirits or earthbounds and what makes you feel<BR>t=
hat way?<BR><BR>I've recently started analyzing a 40 min 469 session. The r=
esults are<BR>scary. I'd say at this point, and I'm only 1/2 way through, 9=
0% of the<BR>communication is negative in nature and mentions many supposed=
 Demonic<BR>names. The layers of voices are, in many cases, multiple. Often=
, the<BR>listener hears very little of what is actually said. The voices ca=
n be<BR>mocking or downright crude. I have not yet formed an opinion fully =
but<BR>it would seem to me that these models are easy devices for lower lev=
el<BR>entities to figure out how to use. I can not speak of the attitudes o=
r<BR>fears of those investigators present although at times, their voices<B=
R>are a bit shaky. <BR><BR>Babs<BR><BR>--- In <A href=3D"mailto:EVP-ITC@yah=

er. I think we have shown<BR>in the past that we can have a disagreement an=
d still remain friends.<BR>You make a lot of good points in your post and I=
 would like to know<BR>who removes time from their recordings. I have never=
 removed time from<BR>my recordings and see no reason why anyone else would=

ed experience with the 12-469's as a single piece of<BR>equipment. I have a=
rranged mine per Mike's, "Spiricomp" design. I have<BR>3, 12-469's feeding =
a four channel mixer, which goes into a laptop<BR>running DC6 with Soundsoa=
p 2. Mine scan equally spaced on the FM band.<BR>I have had pretty good res=
ults until recently.<BR>> <BR>> At first the messages were pretty cle=
ar but I had a feeling I was<BR>getting a different group than I normally h=
ave for the last few years.<BR>When I would ask about my friends on the oth=
er side they would tell me<BR>they will look for them. Well about 2 weeks a=
go the 12-469 arrangement<BR>started generating a lot of interference and f=
eedback. I started<BR>hearing radio static voices as I use to get with shor=
twave. Not voice<BR>fragments but voices made of static (metallic and robot=
ic). They were<BR>breaking through the sweeping. I had a feeling someone el=
se was trying<BR>to force their way through. Finally the interference got s=
o bad I was<BR>forced to revert back to a simpler method I used before, whi=
ch is<BR>using fan noise. One of the first messages to come across was from=

t<BR>used the 12-469's since because of the clear messages I have been<BR>g=
etting using water and fan noise. That does not mean I have given up<BR>&gt=

ince day one, a little over<BR>> <BR>> 6 years ago. I am a believer i=

es the "reply" is also at the same<BR>> <BR>> decibel as the question=

ere is manipulation of the files. Now, what is manipulation to me,<BR>> =

rded<BR>> <BR>> file constitutes manipulation. I do not know if the r=
eply was<BR>> <BR>> intelligent or manipulated to be intelligent. <BR=

ion asker facing the camera and a second hand<BR>> <BR>> clock visibl=
e. Truly, we aren't researching if we don't have some<BR>> <BR>> prot=
ocol in place.<BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> Here is an issue I have w=
ith the RS Hacks. I have the 469. It takes<BR>> <BR>> approximately 1=
8 seconds to scan through the AM frequencies. Now, the<BR>> <BR>> typ=
ical person would think that we can take that 18 seconds and divide<BR>>=
 <BR>> it by the number of AM stations to determine how long we are on e=
ach<BR>> <BR>> station before moving on to the next one. In that way =
we could<BR>> <BR>> determine what is impossible to be said via a rad=
io fragment. However,<BR>> <BR>> that's not correct. The scan cycle c=
an vary from one frequency to the<BR>> <BR>> next and of course the b=
iggest problem is that some stations are<BR>> <BR>> picked up over mu=
ltiple frequencies; AM 640 can be heard on 630, 640,<BR>> <BR>> 650, =
660 and maybe even 670. That extends the time a great deal. This<BR>> <B=
R>> is a difficult problem because it is almost impossible for the avera=
ge<BR>> <BR>> person to be able to make a determination on time this =
way. <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> I heard about the following today;=
 An experimenter records at the same<BR>> <BR>> time every day Mon-Fr=
i. We hear about the importance of meditating,<BR>> <BR>> automatic w=
riting, etc at the same time every day but what we have to<BR>> <BR>>=
 remember with this, is that now we are in essence tuning into the same<BR>=
> <BR>> radio show every day. One of my first experiments with the 46=
9 had me<BR>> <BR>> hearing this deep male voice over and over again.=
 What was he trying<BR>> <BR>> to tell me, I wondered. Than I realize=
d that he was speaking<BR>> <BR>> approximately every 18 seconds; eve=
ry time the scan hit that station.<BR>> <BR>> So, if you are removing=
 up to 18 seconds between words, then you are<BR>> <BR>> really only =
recording the words from one station. <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> T=
his post is IN NO WAY trying to start anything besides discussion<BR>> <=
BR>> about some research problems. I know that there are those who are n=
ot<BR>> <BR>> concerned with anything more than the communication its=
elf but I think<BR>> <BR>> that it is of the utmost importance to att=
empt to factor in some<BR>> <BR>> protocol in order for this to be co=
nsidered serious research at all. <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>&=
